learning_goals.name: LG 1
learning_goals.description: give a definition of enterprises, businesses and organisations

learning_goals.name: LG 2
learning_goals.description: explain the primary and secondary processes of a business

learning_goals.name: LG 3
learning_goals.description: explain the legal form of an organisation

learning_goals.name: LG 4
learning_goals.description: make a distinction between the different relations of an organisation and its environment

learning_goals.name: LG 1
learning_goals.description: Construct, based on a given business case, and interpret simple business process models using UML activity diagrams

learning_goals.name: LG 1
learning_goals.description: Analyse, design and advice on a complete IT service organisation (Organisation, Processes) based on a given case

learning_goals.name: LG 1
learning_goals.description: PRJ21 - Explain the difference between as-is and to-be business processes and demonstrate how use cases support the to-be process by making use of activity diagrams

learning_goals.name: LG 2
learning_goals.description: Students are able to familiarize with a given topic (emerging technology/technique) and are able to prepare a solution (proposal) for this topic within a given context (paper).
